DataElement.preferredName: QuickDASH Outcome Measure 11 Past Week Severity of Sleep Difficulty Because of Pain in Arm, Shoulder, or Hand Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation during the past week of how much difficulty they had sleeping because of the pain in their arm, shoulder or hand, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: QuickDASH Outcome Measure Past Week Severity of Sleep Difficulty Because of Pain in Arm, Shoulder, or Hand Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An 11-item questionnaire designed to measure physical function and symptoms in people with any or multiple musculoskeletal disorders of the upper limb._The most recent week. May include the present day._A question about the difficulty an individual had in sleeping because of the pain in their arm, shoulder, or hand._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An 11-item questionnaire designed to measure physical function and symptoms in people with any or multiple musculoskeletal disorders of the upper limb.

Concepts.definition: An 11-item questionnaire designed to measure physical function and symptoms in people with any or multiple musculoskeletal disorders of the upper limb.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Severity of Sleep Difficulty Because of Pain in Arm, Shoulder, or Hand Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week. May include the present day.:A question about the difficulty an individual had in sleeping because of the pain in their arm, shoulder, or hand.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Severity of Sleep Difficulty Because of Pain in Arm, Shoulder, or Hand
Concepts.definition: A question about the difficulty an individual had in sleeping because of the pain in their arm, shoulder, or hand.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes with range from 1 'No Difficulty' to 5 'So much difficulty that I can't sleep".

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: So Much Difficulty that I Can't Sleep

ValueMeaning.preferredName: So Much Difficulty that I Can't Sleep
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual had so much pain in their arm, shoulder, or hand that they could not sleep.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual had so much pain in their arm, shoulder, or hand that they could not sleep.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had mild difficulty doing something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had severe difficulty doing something.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: QuickDash (Disabilities of the Arm and Shoulder and Hand) Outcome Measure

ReferenceDocuments.name: During the past week, how muc
ReferenceDocuments.description: During the past week, how much difficulty have you had sleeping because of the pain in your arm, shoulder or hand? (circle number)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
